intro: Tabernaemontana tsiangiana, commonly known as the Chinese star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. The flowers are typically borne in clusters at the ends of the branches, adding to its visual appeal.
